text: English pronunciation lesson 13 topic

the flap T part 3
exercise to listen and repeat in Group
one the flap T is between vowel sounds
biting waiting heated invited in group
two we have the flap T with our as a
vowel sound either before it after it or
both before and after artist Hardy 3040
daughter waiter water quarter in group 3
the flap T is written with a double T
batter bitter butter ladder lettuce
litter
ditto Kitty motto in Group four we have
the flap T followed by an unstressed L
sound o battle bottle hospital little
mortal in group five we have the flap T
between words to have smooth connected
speech we are linking words so the t's
that you see in blue have a vowel sound
before and an unstressed vowel sound
after that's why they are flap T's

all furs say the word and you'll repeat
after me bitter winter I want to note
with winter some Americans choose to
drop the T because of the proximity of N
and T when N and T are together T is
sometimes dropped so instead of winter
you may hear winner let's go on terrible
storm today little temperatures return

of tea
from the beginning it's been a very
bitter winter back in December we had a
terrible ice storm and many families
mine included lost electricity today
it's a little warmer than usual but I
know colder temperatures will return
I'll try to stay warm you do the same
a final note this lesson focused on the
flap T but the voiced tap is not limited
to words spelled with the T or a TT you
will often hear at the same sound in
words spelled with a D or a double D in
these examples there is a vowel sound
before the D and an unstressed vowel
sound after listen body madame studio
saddle pedal middle ladder order rider
and in smooth connected speech you'll
also hear more flap T's I had a lot of
studying to do what's to come in the
future

T I can help you practice T at the end
of a word and T as a glottal stop and
